@description.name: @description
@description.body:
*****************************************************************

qooxdoo - the new era of web development http://qooxdoo.org Copyright: 2006 STZ-IDA, Germany, http://www.stz-ida.de License: MIT: https://opensource.org/licenses/MIT See the LICENSE file in the project's top-level directory for details. Authors: Til Schneider (til132) *

@description.name: @description
@description.body: A model that contains all meta data about columns, such as width, renderer, visibility and order.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Fired when the width of a column has changed. The data property of the event is a map having the following attributes:

  • col: The model index of the column the width of which has changed.
  • newWidth: The new width of the column in pixels.
  • oldWidth: The old width of the column in pixels.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired when the visibility of a column has changed. This event is equal to "visibilityChanged", but is fired right before.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Fired when the visibility of a column has changed. The data property of the event is a map having the following attributes:

  • col: The model index of the column the visibility of which has changed.
  • visible: Whether the column is now visible.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Fired when the column order has changed. The data property of the event is a map having the following attributes:

  • col: The model index of the column that was moved.
  • fromOverXPos: The old overall x position of the column.
  • toOverXPos: The new overall x position of the column.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Fired when the cell renderer of a column has changed. The data property of the event is a map having the following attributes:

  • col: The model index of the column that was moved.

@type.name: @type
@type.body: {Integer} the default width of a column in pixels.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Initializes the column model.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
colCount {Integer}
   The number of columns the model should have.
@param.description: The number of columns the model should have.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
table {qx.ui.table.Table}
   The table to which this column model is attached.
@param.description: The table to which this column model is attached.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Return the array of visible columns

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the width of a column.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
col {Integer}
   The model index of the column.
@param.description: The model index of the column.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
width {Integer}
   The new width the column should get in pixels.
@param.description: The new width the column should get in pixels.

@param.name: @param
@param.description: true if the column width is being changed as a result of a pointer drag in the header; false or undefined otherwise.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the width of a column.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: col {Integer} the model index of the column.
@param.description: the model index of the column.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Integer} the width of the column in pixels.
@return.description: the width of the column in pixels.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the header renderer of a column. Use setHeaderCellRenderers instead of this method if you want to set the header renderer of many columns.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: col {Integer} the model index of the column.
@param.description: the model index of the column.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
renderer {qx.ui.table.IHeaderRenderer} the new header renderer the column
      should get.
@param.description:
the new header renderer the column
      should get.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the header renderer of one or more columns. Use this method, in favor of setHeaderCellRenderer, if you want to set the header renderer of many columns. This method fires the "headerCellRendererChanged" event only once, after setting all renderers, whereas setHeaderCellRenderer fires it for each changed renderer which can be slow with many columns.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
renderers {Map}
   Map, where the keys are column numbers and values are the renderers,
   implementing qx.ui.table.IHeaderRenderer, of the the new header
   renderers for that column
@param.description:
Map, where the keys are column numbers and values are the renderers,
   implementing qx.ui.table.IHeaderRenderer, of the the new header
   renderers for that column

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the header renderer of a column.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: col {Integer} the model index of the column.
@param.description: the model index of the column.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qx.ui.table.IHeaderRenderer} the header renderer of the column.
@return.description: the header renderer of the column.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the data renderer of a column.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: col {Integer} the model index of the column.
@param.description: the model index of the column.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
renderer {qx.ui.table.ICellRenderer} the new data renderer
   the column should get.
@param.description:
the new data renderer
   the column should get.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{qx.ui.table.ICellRenderer?null} If an old renderer was set and
   it was not the default renderer, the old renderer is returned for
   pooling or disposing.
@return.description:
If an old renderer was set and
   it was not the default renderer, the old renderer is returned for
   pooling or disposing.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the data renderer of a column.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: col {Integer} the model index of the column.
@param.description: the model index of the column.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qx.ui.table.ICellRenderer} the data renderer of the column.
@return.description: the data renderer of the column.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the cell editor factory of a column.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: col {Integer} the model index of the column.
@param.description: the model index of the column.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: factory {qx.ui.table.ICellEditorFactory} the new cell editor factory the column should get.
@param.description: the new cell editor factory the column should get.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the cell editor factory of a column.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: col {Integer} the model index of the column.
@param.description: the model index of the column.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qx.ui.table.ICellEditorFactory} the cell editor factory of the column.
@return.description: the cell editor factory of the column.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the map that translates model indexes to x positions. The returned map contains for a model index (int) a map having two properties: overX (the overall x position of the column, int) and visX (the visible x position of the column, int). visX is missing for hidden columns.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the number of visible columns.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the model index of a column at a certain visible x position.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: visXPos {Integer} the visible x position of the column.
@param.description: the visible x position of the column.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Integer} the model index of the column.
@return.description: the model index of the column.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the visible x position of a column.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: col {Integer} the model index of the column.
@param.description: the model index of the column.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Integer} the visible x position of the column.
@return.description: the visible x position of the column.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the overall number of columns (including hidden columns).

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the model index of a column at a certain overall x position.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: overXPos {Integer} the overall x position of the column.
@param.description: the overall x position of the column.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Integer} the model index of the column.
@return.description: the model index of the column.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the overall x position of a column.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: col {Integer} the model index of the column.
@param.description: the model index of the column.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Integer} the overall x position of the column.
@return.description: the overall x position of the column.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns whether a certain column is visible.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: col {Integer} the model index of the column.
@param.description: the model index of the column.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets whether a certain column is visible.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: col {Integer} the model index of the column.
@param.description: the model index of the column.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: visible {Boolean} whether the column should be visible.
@param.description: whether the column should be visible.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Moves a column.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: fromOverXPos {Integer} the overall x position of the column to move.
@param.description: the overall x position of the column to move.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
toOverXPos {Integer} the overall x position of where the column should be
      moved to.
@param.description:
the overall x position of where the column should be
      moved to.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Reorders all columns to new overall positions. Will fire one "orderChanged" event without data afterwards

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
newPositions {Integer[]} Array mapping the index of a column in table model to its wanted overall
                            position on screen (both zero based). If the table models holds
                            col0, col1, col2 and col3 and you give [1,3,2,0], the new column order
                            will be col3, col0, col2, col1
@param.description:
Array mapping the index of a column in table model to its wanted overall
                            position on screen (both zero based). If the table models holds
                            col0, col1, col2 and col3 and you give [1,3,2,0], the new column order
                            will be col3, col0, col2, col1

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property qxOwner. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property qxOwner. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Resets the user value of the property qxOwner. The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depending on the property configuration and value availability. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property qxObjectId. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxObjectId}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property qxObjectId. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxObjectId}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Resets the user value of the property qxObjectId. The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depending on the property configuration and value availability. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxObjectId}.
